recipe.name: Chicken and Spinach Strata (Bread Bake)
recipe.description: Dinner in a snap! No chopping, and a great way to use up leftovers.
recipeIngredient: 7 cups french bread (, cut into 2 cm / 1 inch cubes)
1 cup grated cheese ((any melting cheese is fine - tasty, cheddar, mozzarella))
250 g / 8 oz   frozen spinach ((2 packets, chopped))
1 cup shredded or diced chicken (, or any other cooked protein, ham or bacon)

recipeInstructions.text: Defrost the spinach in the microwave (4 minutes on high), then squeeze out excess water.
recipeInstructions.name: Defrost the spinach in the microwave (4 minutes on high), then squeeze out excess water.

recipeInstructions.text: Make Egg mixture: Place ingredients into a bowl and whisk until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Egg mixture: Place ingredients into a bowl and whisk until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread half the bread into the base of a baking dish 25cm x 25cm (10" x 10").
recipeInstructions.name: Spread half the bread into the base of a baking dish 25cm x 25cm (10" x 10").

recipeInstructions.text: Layer with the spinach, then chicken then top with half the cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Layer with the spinach, then chicken then top with half the cheese.

recipeInstructions.text: Top with remaining bread. Squish the bread down to compress (this helps the egg mixture to be soaked up evenly).
recipeInstructions.name: Top with remaining bread. Squish the bread down to compress (this helps the egg mixture to be soaked up evenly).

recipeInstructions.text: Pour over egg mixture - try to cover all the bread evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour over egg mixture - try to cover all the bread evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: Top with remaining cheese, then squish down to help the bread soak up the egg mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Top with remaining cheese, then squish down to help the bread soak up the egg mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Set aside for at least 15 minutes, preferably 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Set aside for at least 15 minutes, preferably 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: To freeze: Cover tightly and place in freezer. Defrost completely before cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: To freeze: Cover tightly and place in freezer. Defrost completely before cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover baking dish with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil, then bake for a further 10 minutes until golden on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover baking dish with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil, then bake for a further 10 minutes until golden on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, sprinkled with parsley if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately, sprinkled with parsley if desired.

review.reviewBody: I made this yesterday for lunch, it was good! I had a leg of ham so used that instead of chicken ( about 3/4 cup chopped ham). Will try it with chicken next time .
I made this as an all veggie version with the silverbeet out of our garden. Was astounded that my meat-loving husband scoffed it down and said it was amazing (jaw drop!). Thanks Nagi x
This dish was amazing and easy to cook with kids. I always find that recipes arenâ€™t accurate but these recipes are very accurate and simple yet delicious.
This was a huge hit in our house! I have a 9yr odl boy who never eats spinach and THIS did the trick! I wondered what is the baking dish you use as I would love to get one!
